result.execSummary:
The defendant Brent N. Boeldt was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Bail Jumping-Felony, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(b).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Consecutive to the jail sentences imposed on 21 CF 496.

miscConds.notes: AODA assessment and follow through counseling.
Maintain fulltime employment, schooling, work search or combination; at the agent's discretion.

Pay supervision fees in an amount to be determined by the Department of Corrections.

Submit to random urine screens and pay for same.

Maintain absolute sobriety.

Submit a DNA sample and pay surcharge.

Assessment, treatment, counseling as deemed appropriate by the Department's assessment process.

If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

2:35 pm - Prosecuting attorney Jacalyn Christie Labre appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Brent N. Boeldt appeared by video, in custody, at Manitowoc County Jail.  Attorney Claire Elisabeth Barth appeared by video for Brent N. Boeldt. Defendant waives their right to a preliminary hearing.  Defendant is bound over to Circuit Court Branch 2 for trial.

Information filed.  Copy served on defense counsel.

Order Denying Petition for Appointment of Counsel.
The petition is denied because public defender appointed Atty. Claire Barth to this case.
Preliminary hearing on June 22, 2022 at 02:30 pm.

3:10 pm - Prosecuting attorney Jill L. Vendetti in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Brent N. Boeldt appeared by video, in custody, at Manitowoc County Jail.  Attorney Claire Elisabeth Barth appeared by video for Brent N. Boeldt.   Attorney Barth was just appointed and requests an adjourned date.  Court finds good cause to toll the time limits.  Preliminary hearing is reset to 06-22-22 at 2:30 p.m. Br. 2.

1:37 PM Defendant Brent N. Boeldt in custody by video.  Attorney Jacalyn Christie Labre appeared by video for State of Wisconsin.   Defendant qualifies for appointment of counsel. Preliminary hearing scheduled for June 6, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

ADDRESS INFO for Brent N. Boeldt
Current: c/o Manitowoc County Jail, Manitowoc, WI 54220 United States  (Effective: 05-26-2022)
Prior: 2122 Granger Road, Manitowoc, WI 54220
Re:  Keeper of drug house, on 05-23-22.
Order to report to MTPD for photo and prints
Commitment for Failure to Furnish Bail.

BAIL HEARING - 
Defendant in custody and appearing by video from the Manitowoc County Jail.  The State informs the Court that the defendant will be charged with the crime of keeper of drug house, 4 cts. felony bail jumping and possess drug paraphernalia.  The matter is continued for initial appearance on 05-31-22 at 2:30 p.m.  Bail is set at $1,000.00 cash bond with the conditions that he report to the Manitowoc City Police Department  for fingerprints, photographs and identifying information within 48 hours or, if incarcerated, within 72 hours of release and defendant is to have no contact with any known drugs users or dealers.  Bail not furnished and defendant is remanded to the custody of the Sheriff.  
Minutes.
